Containers.Description: JDownloader is a free, open-source download management tool with a huge community of developers that makes downloading as easy and fast as it should be.[br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] This is where the JD2 configuration and library files will reside[br][br] Don't forget to enter in the host port and the config folder location. [br][br] [span style='color: #E80000;']8080[/span] is the WebUI port[br] To access the JD2 GUI, open the WebUI. By default downloads will go to /config/Downloads but you can change that in the GUI[br] Ctrl-Alt-Shft brings up the menu where you can switch input method (ie. touch)[br] In order to use the built-in browser for manual recaptcha solving, go to advanced settings, find the following two settings: 1) GeneralSettings: Browser Command Line and 2) BrowserCaptchaSolver: Browser Commandline and change both values to the following: [ "/usr/bin/firefox", "%s" ] (they should be brackets, not less than or greater than signs < >) [br] JDownloader 2 also has a webserver accessible through my.jdownloader.org
Containers.Overview: JDownloader is a free, open-source download management tool with a huge community of developers that makes downloading as easy and fast as it should be. Users can start, stop or pause downloads, set bandwith limitations, auto-extract archives and much more. It's an easy-to-extend framework that can save hours of your valuable time every day! [br] JDownloader 2 also has a webserver accessible through my.jdownloader.org
